snippet: Scrutiny into a blast in East Harlem led the utility to say that most of the people it had trained to connect sections of plastic gas mains had failed to comply with safety regulations.
abstract: Scrutiny by New York State regulators into East Harlem explosion that leveled two buildings and killed eight people in March reveals flaws into how Consolidated Edison trains workers; Con Ed admits that most of 525 people it had trained since 2009 to install network of plastic gas mains had failed to comply with safety regulations but asserts flaws in its training and testing procedures played no role in explosion.
lead_paragraph: Scrutiny into a blast in East Harlem led the utility to say that most of the people it had trained to connect sections of plastic gas mains had failed to comply with safety regulations.

headline.main: Inquiry Reveals Flaws in Training of Con Ed Workers
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Reveals Flaws in Training of Con Ed Workers
